data.title: National Drink Wine Day: Wineries, vineyards, wine shops, south of RVA
data.meta_description: Order wine online from Virginia ABC: Did you know select stores offer home delivery?
data.text:
Order wine online from Virginia ABC: Did you know select stores offer home delivery?

National Drink Wine Day has been celebrated on February 18 across the U.S. for over 15 years. The made-up holiday was created by Todd McCalla to spread the love and health benefits of wine.

At nationaldrinkwineday.org, it states, "Wine has played an important role in history, religion and relationships. We embrace the positive benefits of wine such as new friends, reduced risk of heart disease and the enhancement of food and life."

Some individuals uncork a bottle of wine daily while others only indulge in a glass on special occasions.

According to the Virginia Tourism Corporation, Virginia has over 300 wineries. At virginia.org discover ways to explore Virginia's award-winning wines via wine trails and wine tours across the state.

Wine: Swirl, sniff, taste in Chester, Charles City, Chesterfield

During tasting room hours, wine lovers may enjoy vino made at five family-owned establishments in our readership area.:

Ashton Creek Vineyard - Wed. - Sat. noon - 8 p.m. and Sunday noon - 6 p.m. at 14501 U.S. Rt. 1 in Chester. Visit ashtoncreekvineyard.com.

Dancing Kilt Brewery - Tues. - Wed. 2 - 7 p.m., Thurs. - Fri. 2 - 9 p.m., Sat. noon - 9 p.m. at 12912 Old Stage Rd in Chester. Visit moondropwinery.com.

Spring Run Vineyards - Wed. - Fri. 2 - 6 p.m. [May, June, September and October] at 10700 Spring Run Rd. in Chesterfield. Visit springrunvineyards.com.

Three Leg Run Brewery Winery Meadery - Wed. and Thurs. 4 - 8 p.m., Fri. - Sat. noon - 9 p.m. and Sun. noon - 6 p.m. at 4418 W. Hundred Rd. in Chester. Visit threelegrun.com.

Upper Shirley Vineyards - Wed. - Sun. 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. at 600 Shirley Plantation Rd. in Charles City. Visit uppershirley.com.

Did you know Moondrop Winery is located within Dancing Kilt Brewery? How did Brewmaster/Winemaker Tom Pakurar Jr. come up with the name?

"Patrons tossed ideas in a hat, and my brother's suggestion Moondrop Winery just stuck," Pakurar said.

The urban winery offers flights by the glass or bottle. Pouring at this time, Pakurar, the sole proprietor, has a house red, a cabernet sauvignon, called Red, and a full-bodied merlot with a purple hue. Moondrop Winery's French style red Bordeaux Le Frogg is brewed with grapes from France.

"I'm not allowed to call it Bordeaux even though the grapes come from that region because it was produced here in Chester," Pakurar said.

Wine shops

The Appomattox River Peanut and Wine Company in Hopewell offers a large selection of imported and domestic premium wines. At 424 S. 15th Avenue, owner Randy Sealey offers over 700 bottles of wine from all over the world including a great selection of Virginia wines. Visit appomattoxpeanuts.com for more information.

Wine can be purchased by the bottle and/or box at local ABC [Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority], grocery and retail stores. Virginia ABC stores provide convenient curbside pickup statewide, but did you know home delivery is also an option at participating stores?

"Virginia ABC is proud to support our Virginia wineries. We offer more than 80 varieties of wine at our 398 retail stores," Pat Kane, a public relations specialist with Virginia ABC, said. "We offer same-day delivery within five miles of select stores for orders placed at least two hours before stores close."

Visit abc.virginia.gov to learn more about home delivery, check out the wine selection, and sign up for the Spirited Virginia e-newsletter for the latest news about products.

In the January, February, March 2023 edition of Spirited Virginia, Gwen Hurt and her daughter Brittny are included in the “Who’s the BOS – Black-owned Distillers” feature. Hurt owns Shoe Crazy Wine, a Petersburg-based private label and wholesale wine distribution company. Her products can be purchased at ABC stores as well as Walmart, Target, Total Wine & More and Food Lion. Visit shoecrazywine.com to learn more about the “encore-preneur’s” wines and spirits.

National Margarita Day, also founded by McCalla, is coming up on February 22. Remember to drink responsibly and if you plan to celebrate the unique holidays away from home, establish designated drivers.
